title.native: 通常攻撃が全体攻撃で二回攻撃のお母さんは好きですか？
title.romaji: Tsuujou Kougeki ga Zentai Kougeki de Ni-kai Kougeki no Okaasan wa Suki desu ka?
title.english: Do You Love Your Mom and Her Two-Hit Multi-Target Attacks?

description:
What would you do if you got transported into a video game...with your mom?? That's the dilemma facing high schooler Masato Oosuki, who has been unwittingly thrown into an RPG world with his doting mother close behind as part of a secret government scheme. As an avid gamer, Masato is eager to show off his skills...but that's hard to do when your mom is an insanely overpowered, dual-wielding, multi-target specialist!

(Source: Yen Press)
synonyms: Do You Like Your Mom? Her Normal Attack is Two Attacks at Full Power
Tsuujou Kougeki ga Zentai Kougeki de 2-kai Kougeki no Okaasan wa Suki desu ka?
คุณแม่ที่มีสกิลพื้นฐานเป็นการโจมตีหมู่แถมยังเบิ้ลได้แบบนี้ชอบไหมจ๊ะ

tags.name: MILF
tags.description: Features sexual intercourse with older women.

tags.name: Video Games
tags.description: Centers around characters playing video games.

tags.name: Virtual World
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the world inside a video game.

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

tags.name: Parody
tags.description: Features deliberate exaggeration of popular tropes or a particular genre to comedic effect.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Family Life
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a family unit.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Dragons
tags.description: Prominently features mythical reptiles which generally have wings and can breathe fire.

tags.name: Yandere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is obsessively in love with another, to the point of acting deranged or violent.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

node.description:
__[Website](http://anenarumono.com/) | [Old Twitter](https://twitter.com/iidapochi) | [Current Twitter (NSFW)](https://twitter.com/lizhi3) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/member.php?id=22438) | [Tumblr](http://pochi-goya.tumblr.com) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC22BVlBsZc6ta3Dqz75NU6Q) | [Blog](http://pochigoya0423.blog.shinobi.jp)__

She is also active as a Virtual YouTuber, and is the illustrator of several other VTubers; including Reine Pavolia, Kyu Yukimaru, Lenri Ashieda & Ulta Natsume which she refers to as her "family".

[Website](http://hitodama.info/) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/hitodama1103/)

A Japanese singer, songwriter, radio personality and scriptwriter.

She has released 17 singles and 11 albums since her debut as a 13-year-old in 1994. Several of her songs have been used as anime theme songs. She is often mistaken for a voice actress because she is in the same field of activity as idol-esque voice actresses. When she is working as a screenwriter, she goes by the name Deko Akao, an alias made up from her senior [Satoru Akahori](https://anilist.co/staff/97460/)'s name.

Mother of a son and twin daughters.
Keiji Inai is a Japanese composer and arranger affiliated with the music production company IMAGINE.

__[Website](https://spiraspica.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/spiraspica) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/spiraspica/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCcrVKHnn9O3z0Ao6sUPE7nA)__

__Formed:__ 2013
__Genres:__ J-POP, Rock (Pop Rock)

__Introduction:__
Spira Spica is a Japanese three-piece pop rock band under record labels Tower Records and Sacra Music (2018–), affiliated with the entertainment office Sony Music Artists.

__Biography:__
The band initially formed and began activities in 2013 under the name Snowman. Originally the band only consisted of childhood friends Yuuji and Masuda, but they were later joined by the vocalist Mikiha, who had initially heard of the band after they announced they were looking for a female vocalist.

On January 6, 2018, the band announced they would change their band name from Snowman to Spira Spica, which they have used since.

__Members:__
- [Mikiha](https://anilist.co/staff/169459) (幹葉) – vocalist, in-charge of lyrics
- Yuuji Teranishi (寺西裕二) – guitarist
- Masuda (ますだ) – bassist

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/濱野高年)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule.
_Note: Not to be confused with the [animator](https://anilist.co/staff/254528/)._

**Height:** 153 cm (5'0)

__[Profile (Osawa)](https://osawa-inc.co.jp/women/kayanoai/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kayanoai_0913) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/kayanoai_0913/) | [YouTube Channel Official Twitter](https://twitter.com/_kayanomi) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC0D6qi-Gr5RW7hqOvTEKmAw)__

__Introduction:__
Ai Kayano is a Japanese voice actress and vocalist currently affiliated with Office Osawa.

__Biography:__
Kayano wanted to work in a job that would involve "healing people", leading to initially take up a course at a vocational school. She worked in the beauty industry and became interested in acting after having seen [Aria](https://anilist.co/anime/477/). While attending school, Kayano continued working in the industry and paid for her tuition.

Kayano began working at Pro-Fit in 2010, voicing two supporting characters in the original video animation [Princess Resurrection](https://anilist.co/anime/9159/). In 2011, she voiced [Meiko "Menma" Honma](https://anilist.co/character/40592/) in [Anohana](https://anilist.co/anime/9989/) and received the Best Rookie Actress award for said role at the 6th Seiyuu Awards. Kayano, [Haruka Tomatsu](https://anilist.co/staff/95890/) and [Saori Hayami](https://anilist.co/staff/95869/) performed the series' ending theme "Secret Base – Kimi ga Kureta Mono (10 years after Ver.)", a cover of a song originally sung by the band Zone.

She is often praised for her vocal range, having voiced a variety of characters such as [Mayaka Ibara](https://anilist.co/character/55137/), [Mashiro Shiina](https://anilist.co/character/61371/), [Darkness](https://anilist.co/character/89363/) and [Akari Kawamoto](https://anilist.co/character/24311/) for example, none of which one would connect to the same voice actress.

**Trivia:**
- Worked part-time at a coffee shop with [Chinatsu Akasaki](https://anilist.co/staff/107652/) before becoming a voice actress.
- She got around 100 suggestions for her nickname in the Anohana radio show, from which she herself picked out Kayanon.

Non-anime roles:
- Atago - Azur Lane
- Graf Zeppelin - Azur Lane
- Kaga - Azur Lane
- Renown - Azur Lane
- Y'shtola Rhul - Final Fantasy XIV

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/31969571)

Originating from [Aubec](https://anilist.co/studio/6090/).

_Note: Not to be confused with the [other director](https://anilist.co/staff/242744/) by the same name._

[Website](http://hitodama.info/) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/hitodama1103/)

A Japanese singer, songwriter, radio personality and scriptwriter.

She has released 17 singles and 11 albums since her debut as a 13-year-old in 1994. Several of her songs have been used as anime theme songs. She is often mistaken for a voice actress because she is in the same field of activity as idol-esque voice actresses. When she is working as a screenwriter, she goes by the name Deko Akao, an alias made up from her senior [Satoru Akahori](https://anilist.co/staff/97460/)'s name.

Mother of a son and twin daughters.

streamingEpisodes.title: Episode 1 - The Boy Thought He Was Embarking on a Great Adventure… But, Uh, What’s Going on Here?
Episode 2 - It’s Just a Coincidence They’re All Girls. Got That? Wipe That Smirk Off Your Face.
Episode 3 - Underwear is Armor. Make Sure It’s High in Defense. Otherwise, My Son Might Die!
Episode 4 - Kids Are Kids and Parents Are Parents (but Also Human Beings), and It Takes All Kinds, but They Get Through It Together, Right?
Episode 5 - This is a Territory for Children, Filled With Hopes and Dreams. For Children. That's the Important Part!
Episode 6 - What a Beautiful Girl... Wait, Not You, Mom. Don't Get Near Me in That Outfit, Stop!
Episode 7 - Students are the Protagonists of a School Festival. But People Wearing School Uniforms are Included, Too.
Episode 8 - If I Say Nothing, It Won't Be Heard, But If I Say Something, It'll Be a Critical Hit. It Sucks Being a Family.
Episode 9 - Whoa, There's a Pressure Plate in a Place Like This. Well, I'm Not Stepping On It. No, I'm Saying I Won't!
Episode 10 - The With Mommy Guild Welcomes All! ...Wait, It's a Bunch of Uninvited Guests!
Episode 11 - The Courage to Accept Things. A Loving Heart. Also, Full-Body Armor. That’s What a Mother Needs... Wait, Armor?
Episode 12 - I Hoped Against Hope the Wish Would Not Be Granted. But It Totally Was.
Episode 13 - Do You Love Your Mom on the Shore?
